Privacy Policy

Glosori Inc.(hereinafter referred to as the “Company”) establishes and discloses this Privacy Policy (hereinafter referred to as the “Policy”) in accordance with Article 30 of the Personal Information Protection Act, in order to protect the personal information (hereinafter referred to as “Personal Information”) of users (hereinafter referred to as the “User” or “Individual”) who use the services (hereinafter referred to as the “Services”) provided by the Company, and to ensure the prompt and smooth handling of any privacy-related complaints.

The Company’s core privacy principle is to collect only the minimum amount of personal information necessary for providing the Services, to protect it securely for the required period, and to destroy it safely once the purpose of use has been fulfilled.

Article 1. Items and Methods of Personal Information Collection

1. Items of Personal Information Collected

The Company collects the following personal information to provide effective customer service.

Purpose of Collection Items Collected
User account management & complaint handling Required: Name, date of birth, gender, nationality status (Korean/Foreigner), mobile phone number, ID, email address, home address, smartphone device information (device model, OS, device ID), information provided via third-party login (Kakao, Naver, Google).
For users under 14: Name, date of birth, nationality status, mobile phone number, ID, email address, address, device information, legal guardian verification info. Optional: Call records with numbers classified as suspicious, names and phone numbers of acquaintances registered to Baroman service, and relationship to user.
Service delivery Required: Call recording files, voice files, file metadata (name, duration), location data, IP address, cookies, service access logs, usage history, records of service misuse, latest call logs, contact names and phone numbers stored on device.
Development of new services or technologies Required: IP address, cookies, service access date/time, service usage history, records of misuse.
Payment and billing Required: Service usage records
Optional: Email address
Service quality improvement Required: Call recording files, voice files
Optional: Gender, date of birth, occupation

Users have the right to refuse consent to the collection and use of personal information. However, in such cases, registration and access to the service may be restricted.


2. Methods of Personal Information Collection

The Company collects personal information through the following methods:

Collection Methods

(1) When collecting personal information, the Company always notifies users in advance and obtains their consent. In principle, data is collected directly through user input.

(2) During customer support interactions, personal information may be collected via the app, email, fax, or phone.

(3) Personal information may be collected in writing at offline events such as seminars or promotional campaigns.

(4) The Company may receive personal information from third-party partners. In such cases, the partner organization is responsible for obtaining prior consent from the user, in accordance with the Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization or the Personal Information Protection Act.

(5) Additional personal information may be generated or collected during service usage or business operations. Certain device-generated data, such as device information, may be automatically collected while using the app.

Article 2. Retention and Use Period of Personal Information

In principle, the Company promptly destroys personal information once the purpose of its collection and use has been fulfilled, such as upon user withdrawal or revocation of service consent, unless retention is required by applicable laws.

However, if certain information must be retained for a specified period in accordance with relevant laws, the Company stores such information for the period defined below.

Retention Item Retention Period (from date of occurrence) Legal Basis
Records related to contracts or withdrawal of offers 5 years Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce
Records of payment and supply of goods/services 5 years Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce
Records of customer complaints or dispute resolution 3 years Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce
Records of credit information collection and usage 3 years Credit Information Use and Protection Act
Service usage access logs (login records) 3 months Protection of Communications Secrets Act

Article 3. Procedures and Methods for Destruction of Personal Information

1. The Company shall promptly destroy personal information when the retention period has expired or the purpose of processing has been achieved and the information is no longer needed.

2. If the personal information must be retained even after the agreed retention period or processing purpose has been fulfilled due to legal obligations, such information is transferred to a separate database or stored in a different location.

3. The procedures and methods for destroying personal information are as follows:

  • • Destruction Procedure: Personal information collected for service provision is retained for a certain period according to internal policy or relevant laws and regulations, then destroyed.
  • • Destruction Method: Personal information in electronic file format is destroyed using technical methods that prevent data recovery or reproduction. Personal information printed on paper is destroyed by shredding or incineration.

Article 4. Provision of Personal Information to Third Parties

1. Principle and Exceptions
The Company uses personal information only within the scope notified in Article 1 and does not provide it to third parties without consent. However, the following cases are exceptions:

  • • When requested by investigative authorities under relevant laws for investigative purposes
  • • When required by procedures specified in other applicable laws
  • • When data is provided to advertisers, partners, or research institutions in a form that does not identify specific individuals for statistical, academic, or market research purposes
  • • When the user has given prior consent

2. Efforts to Minimize Disclosure
Even when disclosing information under the above exceptions, the Company takes all reasonable measures to avoid excessive or unrelated data sharing beyond the original purpose of collection.

3. Third-Party Provision with User Consent
The Company provides personal information to third parties only with prior consent from the user, as shown below. Users may refuse such consent, and while they can still use the core services, features that rely on third-party sharing may be restricted.

Recipient Information Provided Purpose of Provision Retention Period
Acquaintances (registered in Baroman service) Call history with flagged numbers, location data, phone usage data Provision of Baroman safety service to acquaintances Until service termination
Financial institutions Mobile phone number, email address, recorded call content Voice phishing prevention activities Until contract termination with institution
Police, Financial Security Institute, Financial Supervisory Service Mobile phone number, email address, recorded call content Prevention and investigation of voice phishing incidents Until completion of investigation

4. Refusal of Consent and Its Effect

Users may refuse to provide information to acquaintances; however, in such cases, the Baroman service may be restricted.

5. Refusal of Consent and Its Effect

Users may also refuse to provide information to financial institutions or related authorities, but services linked to such institutions may become unavailable.

Article 5. Outsourcing of Personal Information Processing

1. Overview of Delegated Processing
The Company may delegate personal information processing tasks to the following service providers in order to improve service quality.

Delegatee Delegated Tasks Retention & Use Period
Ellis Group Co., Ltd. Infrastructure operation for service delivery, fraud prevention, data backup Until user withdrawal or end of contract
Korea Mobile Authentication Identity verification service Until user withdrawal or end of contract
Korea Credit Bureau Co., Ltd. Identity verification service Until user withdrawal or end of contract

2. Contractual Safeguards
In accordance with Article 25 of the Personal Information Protection Act, the Company includes the following in its outsourcing contracts and supervises the entrusted entities:

  • • Prohibition of processing personal data for purposes other than the delegated tasks
  • • Implementation of technical and administrative protection measures
  • • Restriction on further subcontracting
  • • Oversight and supervision of the trustee
  • • Liability for any damages caused

3. Disclosure of Changes
If there are any changes in the scope of delegated tasks or the service providers, the Company will promptly disclose such changes through this privacy policy.

4. Data Minimization
Only the minimum necessary personal information is shared with trustees to fulfill the relevant purposes. Depending on the user’s request, data is selectively provided to the appropriate service provider.

5. Notification on Changes
The list of outsourcing service providers may change depending on service modifications or contract duration, in which case users will be notified in advance via the service notice.

2. Consent and Right to Refuse
Users may refuse the overseas transfer of personal data by contacting the Company’s Data Protection Officer. If a user refuses consent, their personal information will be excluded from the overseas transfer. However, services that require overseas processing may become unavailable in whole or in part.

Article 7. Rights of Users and Legal Representatives and How to Exercise Them

1. How to Exercise Rights
Users and their legal representatives may, at any time, request to access, modify, delete, suspend processing of, or withdraw consent regarding their registered personal information by contacting the Company’s Data Protection Officer via written request, telephone, or email.

2. Response and Exceptions
Upon such request, the Company will promptly take appropriate actions. However, requests may be denied or limited in the following circumstances:

  • • Where access is prohibited or restricted by law
  • • Where there is concern that the request may harm another person’s life, body, property, or other rights and interests

3. Handling of Deleted Information
Personal information that is deleted or terminated at the user’s request will be processed in accordance with Article 2 (Retention and Use Period), and will not be used or accessed for any other purposes.

Article 8. User Responsibilities and Obligations

1. Providing Accurate Information
Users are responsible for entering their personal information accurately and keeping it up to date. The Company shall not be held liable for any damages caused by inaccurate information submitted by the user. Submitting false or stolen information, including impersonating another person, may result in the termination of membership.

2. Obligation to Protect One’s Own and Others’ Data
While users have the right to the protection of their personal data, they also have the obligation to safeguard their own information and refrain from infringing on others’ data. Users must take precautions to prevent the leakage of personal data such as passwords and must not tamper with or misuse other individuals’ personal information (e.g. via posts or messages). Failure to fulfill these obligations may result in legal penalties in accordance with relevant laws, such as the Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization and Information Protection.

Article 9. Installation and Operation of Automated Data Collection Devices and Opt-Out

1. Use of Cookies
The Company uses cookies to store and retrieve information for providing personalized services to users.

2. Use of Cookies
A cookie is a small data file sent by the server to the user’s browser and stored on their device (computer or mobile).

3. Information Collected via Cookies
The Company collects device and cookie information for the following purposes:

  • • Preventing unauthorized or fraudulent use of the service
  • • Providing services optimized for the user’s device

This may include device model, OS type, IP address, advertising identifiers, mobile app ID, etc.

4. Cookie Opt-Out
Users may opt out of the collection of advertising identifiers through the following settings:

  • • Android: Google Settings > Ads > Opt out of Ads Personalization

5. Consequences of Cookie Refusal
If a user chooses to block or delete cookies, certain personalized services may become unavailable.

Article 10. Measures to Ensure the Security of Personal Information

In accordance with Article 29 of the Personal Information Protection Act, the Company takes the following measures to ensure the security of personal information:

  • • Minimization and training of personnel handling personal data: The Company limits the number of employees with access to personal information to the minimum necessary and provides them with appropriate training.
  • • Technical measures against hacking, etc.: The Company implements technical and administrative safeguards to prevent the loss, theft, leakage, alteration, or damage of personal data during processing.
  • • Access control to personal information systems: Access to databases that process personal information is granted, changed, or revoked as necessary. Firewalls and intrusion prevention systems are used to block unauthorized external access.
  • • Encryption of personal information: User passwords are stored and managed in encrypted form and accessible only by the individual. Other critical data is encrypted during storage and transmission or protected through secure locking mechanisms.

Article 12. Remedies for Infringement of Rights

1. Contact for Inquiries and Complaints
Users may contact the Company’s Data Protection Officer (DPO) regarding any inquiries, complaints, or remedies related to the protection of their personal data.
For further assistance with personal data infringement, users may also contact the institutions below:

  • • Personal Information Dispute Mediation Committee (www.kopico.go.kr / +82-1833-6972)
  • • Personal Information Infringement Report Center (privacy.kisa.or.kr / 118)
  • • Supreme Prosecutors' Office Cyber Crime Investigation Center (www.spo.go.kr / +82-2-3480-2000)
  • • National Police Agency Cyber Bureau (cyberbureau.police.go.kr / 182)

2. Administrative Appeal Procedure
If a user suffers infringement of rights due to a public institution’s refusal or inaction regarding requests for access, correction, deletion, or suspension of personal data processing under Articles 35 to 37 of the Personal Information Protection Act, they may file an administrative appeal as prescribed by law.

  • • Central Administrative Appeals Commission (www.simpan.go.kr / 110)

Article 13. Duty of Notification

This Privacy Policy was established on April 10, 2025, and may be revised in accordance with changes to applicable laws, policies, or security technologies. Any changes, additions, or deletions will be notified to users through the application or website.
